remarks: The defining equation for h(x,x',y)=y' in part (2) in [Baer] p. 45 line 24.  (Contributed by NM, 16-May-2015.)
statement:
hdmap1val2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
hdmap1val2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1val2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
hdmap1val2.s $e |- .- = ( -g ` U ) $.
hdmap1val2.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
hdmap1val2.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
hdmap1val2.c $e |- C = ( ( LCDual ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1val2.d $e |- D = ( Base ` C ) $.
hdmap1val2.r $e |- R = ( -g ` C ) $.
hdmap1val2.l $e |- L = ( LSpan ` C ) $.
hdmap1val2.m $e |- M = ( ( mapd ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1val2.i $e |- I = ( ( HDMap1 ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1val2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
hdmap1eq.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
hdmap1eq.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. D ) $.
hdmap1eq.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
hdmap1eq.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. D ) $.
hdmap1eq.e $e |- ( ph -> ( N ` { X } ) =/= ( N ` { Y } ) ) $.
hdmap1eq.mn $e |- ( ph -> ( M ` ( N ` { X } ) ) = ( L ` { F } ) ) $.
hdmap1eq $p |- ( ph -> ( ( I ` <. X , F , Y >. ) = G <-> ( ( M ` ( N ` { Y } ) ) = ( L ` { G } ) /\ ( M ` ( N ` { ( X .- Y ) } ) ) = ( L ` { ( F R G ) } ) ) ) ) $.
